newsitem.title: USA: Xcellenet says David Held to become cfo.
newsitem.headline: Xcellenet says David Held to become cfo.

text.p: Xcellenet said late Wednesday that David Held, currently the director of finance and controller, has been named the new chief financial officer.
In a statement, the company said Held will replace Sidney Sack, who is leaving the company, effective July 31, 1997, to pursue other interests.

Commenting on the mangement changes, Dennis Crumpler, chairman and chief executive officer of Xcellenet said: "As he (Sack) departs, we are confident of a smooth transition because of the excellent job Sid has done preparing Dave and Jeanne for their additional responsibilities. We wish Sid well as he pursues his objective of expanding his role beyond that of a CFO."

In addition to the changes in the position of cfo, the company said Jeanne Bateman, who holds the positions of the vice president of finance, secretary and treasurer, will expand her responsibilities to include the Human Resources function and legal services.
Seperately, Xcellenet reported a second quarter loss of $32,000, compared with a profit of $363,000, or $0.05 a share, during the same time last year.
